an4.102:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these four kinds of clouds.
an4.102:4.3: ~One thunders but doesn’t rain, ~one rains but doesn’t thunder, ~one neither thunders nor rains, and ~one both rains and thunders.
an4.102:4.4: These are the four kinds of clouds.
an4.102:4.5: In the same way, these four people similar to clouds are found in the world.
an4.102:4.7: ~One thunders but doesn’t rain, ~one rains but doesn’t thunder, ~one neither thunders nor rains, and ~one both rains and thunders.
an4.102:5.1: And how does a person thunder but not rain?
an4.102:5.2: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching—
an4.102:5.3: statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired sayings, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and analyses.
an4.102:5.4: But they don’t truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.
an4.102:5.5: That’s how a person thunders but doesn’t rain.
an4.102:5.6: That person is like a cloud that thunders but doesn’t rain, I say.
an4.102:6.1: And how does a person rain but not thunder?
an4.102:6.2: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.102:6.4: But they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.102:7.1: And how does a person neither thunder nor rain?
an4.102:7.2: It’s when a person doesn’t memorize the teaching …
an4.102:7.4: Nor do they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.102:8.1: And how does a person both thunder and rain?
an4.102:8.2: It’s when a person memorizes the teaching—
an4.102:8.4: And they truly understand: ‘This is suffering’ …
an4.102:8.8: These four people similar to clouds are found in the world.”
